html: As the millennial age dawns, Jehovah’s dead—the righteous departed—“live” or “regenerate” (yihiyu) when their bodies “arise” or resurrect” (yequmun) (cf.Isaiah 25:7-8). Unlike persons in the Perdition category—who don’t “regenerate” or “resurrect” (v 14)—Jehovah’s holy ones, who are affiliated with Zion, awake and arise from the dust: “Awake, arise; clothe yourself with power, O Zion!... Shake yourself free, rise from the dust; sit enthroned, O Jerusalem” (Isaiah 52:1-2 ; cf.51:9). Like the dew of sunrise that revives plant life, Jehovah’s coming to his elect regenerates them (Isaiah 35:4-6; 66:14).
